Entries.default: Her eyebrows quirk in surprise.
"You can try."
"Calm down. You must have misheard me."
"Few weeks at sea'll do that." She digs around in her ear with her pinky.
"At 'em!" She raises her own weapon.
"We've had some complications. The price is doubled." She gives you a crooked grin and watches you carefully.
"Deal."
"I'm not paying."
"Glad we could do business."
"Deal."
"Glad we could do business."
"I don't have the money."
"You mean the Vailian Trading Company."

"What matters is that I'm giving you the chance to buy it first."

Perin shoots her a quizzical look.

A long, sleek ship rides low in the water. Its crew stands protectively around a cluster of crates positioned on the main deck.

A woman saunters across the deck, her roughly chopped hair swinging with her stride.
He sighs dramatically. "I'd happily tell you if you stopped interrupting my count." He rolls his eyes skyward.
His eyes go wide. He clears his throat.
"In that case, I'll honor the original price. Consider that a discount among friends." Widla gives you a once-over.
"Deal."
"Glad we could do business."
"Why did you raise the price?"
"Let's just say there are other folks who'd be happy to pay my price."
"Then you also know they've got guns. And you want them to be happy with this deal."
"Fine. Two thousand it is."
"Then I'll be forced to relieve your necks of their heads."
Before she can say anything, a handful of them back into the hold.
The door shuts, and you hear the heavy thump of the bar falling into place.
His eyes go wide. An undignified yelp escapes his throat.
"Looks like we've got a bounty to collect." She whistles through her teeth and grins.
"Do you know who I'm representing?"
"I know they've got the cash."
"The Royal Deadfire Company has a long memory, too."
"And I've got a fast ship. That's why they hired me."
"Wait just a minute. Widla, you never said anything about-"

"'Cause then I'd never hear an end to your nattering. 

"So drop it. Everyone else here wants to get paid."

But even as she says it, an uneasy murmur passes through her crew.
"You won't be in business long if you treat your contacts this way."
"That's the point - I don't want to be in it long. I want to fill my hold with cash and retire early."

He clears his throat.

"Had. Or don't you remember-"

"I'll remember THIS when I'm doling out rations tonight if you don't shut your mouth." 

She glares at Perin.
"I'm just the middleman. Maybe you could throw in something extra for me."

"I've got a few things you might like. I'll have my crew bring them up once we're done here.

"Consider it your commission." She smirks.
"Then I'll just have to take whatever you've got."
"I see."
"So. You buying or looking?"
"Perin, how much do you trust your captain?"

He looks between you and Widla.

She jumps in before he says anything.

"And who are you to be asking? This is my crew, and they listen to me."

But uncertainty lingers in the air like a sour stench.
"Perin, she's going to get you all killed. Now's the time to step up."
He hesitates. Widla steps forward, furious.
"What do you think you're doing? I'm going to the Consuaglo with this! You'll all be stripped of your colors!"
The other pirates escort her to the hold.
Once the hold is barred shut and Widla's protests muffled and distant, Perin turns back to you and mops perspiration from his temples.
"Deal."
"I don't have the money."

Perin counts the money twice.

Once he's satisfied, he nods to his crew.
[Attack] "Thanks for getting rid of your captain for me."
"Damn you!" He draws his weapon with a shaking hand.

He sighs. "Well, that's unfortunate."

He whistles, and he and the remaining crew draw their weapons.
"I'm not paying."
"Come on, Perin. Show her what you're made of."
He hesitates, blinking between you and Widla.

"Oh, we all will. At 'em!" 

Widla draws her weapon, and she and the other pirates charge.
"But does Perin? It would be convenient for him if something happened to you."
"You and me'll talk later. For now, you'll wait below."

No one else moves to stop him.

With a groan, he heads below.
"I'd say we've talked enough for today. You ready to finish this?"
"Fine. One thousand it is."
"Fine, I'll give them a discount - five hundred. But only 'cause I like you." She smirks.
"Then give them a better deal today and get more work from them in the future."
Her rolling laugh is echoed by her crew.
"Deal."
"Glad we could do business. But you tell our mutual friend that I gave you a deal, hear?"
"If you say so."
"Let's get to the part where you pay me and we part ways, all right?" She folds her arms.

"We set or not, Perin?" 

She bangs her fist against one of the crates. The dwarven man standing near her flinches as though she'd hit him.
"You've had days to count. Now it's time we talked about the price." She turns her attention to you, eyes gleaming. Perin follows her gaze.
She cackles and thumps him on the back. He staggers forward and shoots her a venomous glare.
"Careful. This one's got friends in the Consuaglo."
"It's him! He's wanted by the entire Consuaglo!" He points at you.
Entries.female: "It's her! She's wanted by the entire Consuaglo!" He points at you.

Entries.default: She laughs. "Don't act insulted. I've heard enough to know you'd do the same."
She laughs. "Guess you've never snuck a few coppers from the tip jar."
She laughs. "You've got enough sense that I don't have to explain it."
"There's plenty of business for enterprising sorts in Deadfire. And I have arrangements with every major power in the archipelago."

Widla is a little too fast to respond.

Almost as if she's trying to stop you from saying more.

"We didn't become pirates to work more.

"Now, if you want the cargo, you'll pay up."
He shrinks back.

"You can't believe this. Don't you see what-"

But Widla silences him with a glare.
"You and your Rauataian friends don't scare me! We'll come after you even if it's the last-"

"Take her below!"

The others turn and stare at Perin, whose face is red and glistening with sweat.

For a moment, nothing happens. Then, a pair of deckhands take Widla by the arms.
"Listen, I'll honor the original price of a thousand coppers. Let's just conclude this and be on our way."
"You oughtta reconsider. Else we'll be forced to relieve you of what you have." She rests her hand on her weapon.

"You told us this was a simple exchange, Widla." 

The pirates look at one another.
"Let the cowards hide. We're more'n enough to deal with you."
